alert.note: Alert for Fillmore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 24 at 7:35AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Minnesota, including the following county, Fillmore. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 AM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the town of Spring Valley. Portions of HWY 63 are closed. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Spring Valley Creek, Forestville Creek, Bear Creek, Deer Creek, Little Kingsley Creek and South Branch Root River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Spring Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
